revisions.*: Because "rvslots" was not specified, a legacy format has been used for the output. This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used.

Donk 1962 |publisher=Encyclopedia of Life |accessdate=17 May 2011 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.mycobank.org/MycoTaxo.aspx?Link=T&Rec=339961 |title=Tephrocybe rancida (Fr.) Donk 1962 |publisher=MycoBank |accessdate=17 May 2011 }} | synonyms = ''Agaricus rancidus'' [[Elias Magnus Fries|Fr.]] 1821
''Collybia rancida'' ([[Elias Magnus Fries|Fr.]]) [[Lucien Quélet|Quél.]] 1872
''Tephrophana rancida'' ([[Elias Magnus Fries|Fr.]]) [[Robert Kühner|Kühner]] 1938
''Lyophyllum rancidum'' ([[Elias Magnus Fries|Fr.]]) [[Rolf Singer|Singer]] 1943 }} {{ mycomorphbox | name = Tephrocybe rancida | whichGills = free | capShape = convex | capShape2 = flat | hymeniumType = gills | stipeCharacter = bare | ecologicalType = saprotrophic | sporePrintColor = white | howEdible = unknown | howEdible2 = inedible }} {{Portal|Fungi}} '''''Tephrocybe rancida''''' is a species of [[fungus]] in the family [[Lyophyllaceae]]. It was first described by Swedish mycologist [[Elias Magnus Fries]] in 1821. '''T.rancida''' is commonly called the '''Rancid Greyling''' due to its typical coloring and rancid smell and taste. ==Description== [[Pileus (mycology)|Cap]] 1–4 cm in diameter. Convex to flat, umbonate. Grey to brown-grey starting with a whitish bloom. Shiny when wet. [[Lamella (mycology)|Gills]] Free, crowded, grey. [[Stipe (mycology)|Stem]] 4–8 cm long by 3–7 mm in diameter, concolorous with cap. [[basidiospore|Spore]]s white or cream, ellipsoid, 7–8 × 3–4.5 m. ==Distribution and habitat== Found growing from the ground, solitary in deciduous woodland. Early autumn to early winter. Rare. North America and Europe. ==Edibility== Unknown, inedible due to rancid smell and taste.{{citation needed|date=August 2013}} ==External links== * [http://www.nahuby.sk/atlas-hub/Tephrocybe-rancida/sivolupenovka/penizovka-pachnouci/ID10953 ''Tephrocybe rancida'' in Europe ] {{Commons category}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20120823102340/http://www.rogersmushrooms.com/gallery/DisplayBlock~bid~5828~gid~~source~gallerydefault.asp C.rancida at Rogers Mushrooms] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Taxonbar|from=Q3914315}} [[Category:Lyophyllaceae]] [[Category:Fungi of North America]] [[Category:Fungi of Europe]] [[Category:Taxa named by Elias Magnus Fries]] [[Category:Fungi described in 1821]]
